website_summaries.verdict: A great budget choice that makes absolutely no compromises on safety or performance. Offers the best value for your money.
pros: Provides the same basic safety features as its competitors for a much lower price
cons: Some users report that this seat is a bit difficult to install

customer_reviews.title: Best carseat ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great carseat! I love it. I have both my 3 year old and 1 year old in it. One is rear facing and the other forward facing. They both love their seats and are always comfortable looking. Their heads never fall forward while sleeping either. We were recently in a 6x rollover accident at 70mph with our boys in this brand of carseat. Neither of them were injured at all! I will never own another brand of seat.
customer_reviews.author: FultonWifeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Washing the cover takes endless time and patience
customer_reviews.text: Whoever designed the cover of this thing deserves a special place in hell. Only buy this if your child will never have a blowout, get carsick, or otherwise require the thing to be cleaned. You'll need endless patience and elves with tiny but impossibly long fingers to get the darn cover back on the seat. I hate this thing. Waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: satisfied with this car seat
customer_reviews.text: Overall, satisfied with this car seat! We're die heart Britax fans when it comes to everything but I hate that they never have cup holders. So after careful review, we went with this one! The only thing I'm not satisfied with is the color. It looks SIGNIFICANTLY different then the photo so be aware. It's not grey. It's like a brown purple almost.
customer_reviews.author: Jordyn

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Down
customer_reviews.text: We could not get the lower strap to tighten down to the vehicle seat. After looking deeper into reviews there were many that had the same problem. Amazon was great to work with and accepted our return.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Such a pain in the rear to wash! Seriously ...
customer_reviews.text: Such a pain in the rear to wash! Seriously graco get it together make these things easier to take apart. And my daughter's head always slouchs in a uncomfortable way when she sleeps in here.
customer_reviews.author: melody

customer_reviews.title: Straps are impossible to tighten down appropriately for safety
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid more attention to the other posts about the straps being difficult to cinch down. They really are very difficult to tighten down on my child. Both the straps that go on the child and the straps that anchor the carseat to the car--they're both difficult to cinch down tight. I had the chicco keyfit infant seat before needing to upgrade to a convertible carseat. The strap quality between the two is huge. I never had any problems cinching the straps on my chicco. I purchased the extend2fit because my toddler is tall for her age and I was hoping this would allow me to keep her rear facing longer--which it has.
customer_reviews.author: keller

customer_reviews.title: Awesome car seat
customer_reviews.text: I love this car seat. I have bought 3 so far!! One for myself, my husband and my mother... we all have this car seat in our cars and love it. My son grew quickly out of the Chicco infant car seat and I was scrambling to find something that would grow with him. He sits very comfortable in it. He also doesn't sweat a lot in it. I live in Florida and it is pretty hot year round. I wanted to find something that wouldn't make him too hot. So far this car seat has done an awesome job! I would recommend this car seat, I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: natalie31

customer_reviews.title: Sweats
customer_reviews.text: We want to love this carseat. It's a beautiful shade of blue. Very padded and comfortable for our 2 hour car ride a every day. My only concern; the tag that's adhered to the back of the seat. The tag gets very hot in my Florida weather. I have to be very cautious before putting baby in. Also, she sweats terribly in this seat. Otherwise, we really enjoy all of the features this seat offers :)
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Adams

customer_reviews.title: Tough to Tighten
customer_reviews.text: Love this car seat however the straps don't tighten against my daughter properly without some force. It takes some muscle to pull them tight. We have taken the seat out to make sure nothing is caught and it continues to happen. I have contacted Graco for assistance and haven't herd anything back. We love the seat, just wish it wasn't so difficult to tighten. It is our secondary seat in my husband's car so not used as much, but it's still a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Heather G.

customer_reviews.title: I'd say mostly I'm very pleased with my amazon purchases
customer_reviews.text: I buy a lot from amazon. I'd say mostly I'm very pleased with my amazon purchases. Both amazon and my best friend had decent opinions of this seat but this seat DOES NOT get a tight install. I'm an ICU nurse and can't imagine having an accident with this seat on my conscience. The britex marathon clicktight seat installs in 30 seconds and doesnt wiggle a half centimeter. It's as tight as the manufacture seat of the cars we own. Not even a wiggle. I replaced all seats with the britex and tossed this one. I'm not a complainer or a reviewer but this seat isn't worth your child's safety or money. The color was cute, however.
customer_reviews.author: laurenmarie

customer_reviews.title: Difficult install, still prefer Britax
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this seat. I have been a die hard Britax fan for years, especially since Clicktight came out. However, Graco makes good products in a reasonable price bracket and I love that this seat rear faces to 50lbs. However, the material feels cheap/uncomfortable and the seat is too hard to install. I could not get a secure install using LATCH so I used the seatbelt. I literally have scratches and bruises from guiding the belt through the RF belt pack. Come on Graco, get with the times and utilize that SnugLock technology. I have very thin and long fingers, I cannot imagine how my husband would have gotten the belt through.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Love this seat!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great seat! Fairly easy to install, with great features. The recline feature is amazing and I love that you don’t have to remove the harness to adjust the height. Speaking of height, the super tall shell, leg room extension, and 50 lb weight limit make this a perfect seat for extended rear facing. My only quibble is that the little slots to keep the buckles out of the way don’t work right for me. My daughter is almost 2, so not a tiny infant, and the buckles don’t really reach the storage slots. I’d also like to see an easy seatbelt install, like Graco’s new infant seats or Britax’s ClickTight.
customer_reviews.author: ALH

customer_reviews.title: Hated this car seat
customer_reviews.text: My son is very big for his age and had to go into a convertible car at 7 months old. I had a Chicco Nextfit zip for my first son but I wanted to have my son rear facing as long as I could so I took the leap and bought these. I absolutely hated everything about them. The shoulder strap covers never stayed on. The shoulder strap in general were always to loose or to tight. The leg straps always fit his thigh incorrectly and left marks. He was so uncomfortable in it. I tried for 5 months and finally got the Chicco and he loves it. Never buying a Graco car seat again.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Mcainey

customer_reviews.title: Best car seat for extended rear facing, hands down!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love our Extend2fits. This is the second we’ve bought and I honestly would never buy another convertible car seat. This one was purchased for my 10 month old (17 lbs, 26in) and he’s super cozy with all the extra padding in there. My 3.5 year old still COMPFORTABLY fits rear facing in his E2f too, with room to grow still! This seat will allow us to rear face until probably 5. It’s also easy to install and I don’t feel like it takes up a ton of space, even with the foot tray out for my toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Tairra Leckemby

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase! Fast shipping too!
customer_reviews.text: I was kindof a carseat brand snob before getting this bad boy, I honestly never expected to get a Graco. But my 2 year old was just not loving his Britax Marathon anymore. His shoulders were cramped and his legs were crunched up while rear facing. I heard really great things about this car seat, so I decided to snag this up while it was on sale and give it a whirl. He now falls asleep almost every time he’s in the car, and is able to sit comfortably rear facing with more leg room. I love it so much I plan on grabbing another once his little brother outgrows his infant seat!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great size . Super comfortable. My 2 year old fits great
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was pretty fast despite covid . Not over night but received it within the week . This car seat is perfect, I wish I purchased it sooner. My two year old fits in it perfectly and I can tell it’ll fit him for a while . The head rest adjust so much and so easily , a 5 year old can sit comfortably. The design is very nice , sleek and stylish and will fit well in our BMW . It has a lot of padding and seems comfortable and safe . Also the size isn’t overwhelming but it can still accommodate a large child . And still be passed on to a new born . Just buy it
customer_reviews.author: Raya_Rebelle

customer_reviews.title: Best seat ever!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this seat for our ever growing 16 month old upon recommendation from many mom groups. We were a little worried about it fitting into our 2 door 2009 Honda Civic but needn't of! It is compact, sturdy and installs in minutes with room to spare. Our toddler loves it and is comfortable with room to grow and then some. We plan to keep her rear facing until she maxes out the seat height/weight limits and couldn't be happier. Highly recommend to others!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchel Cacciola

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable and adjustable carseat
customer_reviews.text: First off, I have no idea how people find this seat so challenging. It's adjustable in every way imaginable. It's easy to fit and tighten appropriately. I've taken it apart several times to wash in the almost 2 years we've had it. Everything comes off easily including the straps. If you have any trouble remembering how to reassemble it, just watch a video online. Not hard at all. My son has been perfectly comfortable in it from day one and we are about to purchase another one for our second child. Its super easy to install and remove.
customer_reviews.author: ASHLEY COLEMAN

customer_reviews.title: NOT safe. Buy the SlimFit
customer_reviews.text: This seat is near impossible to get fully tight against my 16 month olds chest. It takes a large amount of effort, and when you’re in a rush it’s easy to give up, and then your child is loosely in a seat and in danger. I have contacted Graco support. After a lengthy process of all their requested pictures and videos to show them the problem, their response was to pull the cord straight forward. Difficult to do fully when you safely rear-face your child and the pull-cord is against the seat. I have the Slimfit in another car and you can 10x more easily tighten the straps to the safe amount. Disappointed in Gracos support
customer_reviews.author: Erin Feeney

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I were looking for a second car seat so we could have one in each car. We decided to buy this one since we like Graco and we couldnt beat the price. The material is soft, has extra padding and looks comfy and the baby loves it. We bought a Graco slim fit at buybuy baby for double the price and I wish we would of looked here first since we like this car seat better. Its super easy to install and the extra couple holes for that middle buckle is amazing that way the little thighs/ legs arent tight when they are strapped in... we definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Car seat! Visibly more comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my growing 2 year old from our Graco Snuglock. She seems to be so much more comfortable in this, and loves that there are cup holders. MUCH easier to install than the snuglock and would recommend this one over the snuglock with the ridiculously hard to install base. It is super easy to remove the lining to be able to clean if you ever need to. But it also stays in place and doesn't move around easily. One problem I have found, is while still rear facing, the leg extension is pointless and unable to be used, so plan on using that for front facing.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A

customer_reviews.title: Graco vs Chicco
customer_reviews.text: We transitioned from a Chicco infant seat to this seat. We knew safety was the same, so we opted for the lower price of the Gracco. It’s easy enough to install, but we found it very difficult to adjust compared to the Chicco. You have to have small hands to loosen the straps or adjust the tilt while the seat is installed rear facing. It will probably be fine when forward facing, but we are about 20#s from that stage. Otherwise it’s a very next seat. Looks great, good leg room, easy headrest adjustment, we love the cup holders.
customer_reviews.author: molly reeves

customer_reviews.title: Answer to our prayers!
customer_reviews.text: Our 1 year old daughter is very tall (99th percentile) so she outgrew her last car seat very quickly. Decided to try this product after reading all the great reviews and very happy that we did! It arrived quickly, already assembled and VERY easy to use! With the head space extender, she is going to be able to use this seat for quite a while! The latch feature snapped in very easily to our car and the overall design is very clean. My only complaint is the tightening belt is a little stiff and I had to really pull from the back to make sure the seat belt restraint was tight enough across my daughters chest
customer_reviews.author: Christina G

customer_reviews.title: Hard to quickly secure child.
customer_reviews.text: Use this for 2 year grandson. PROS: It’s sturdy and well made. Install was a 3 on scale of 5. CONS: it’s takes 2 to 3 minutes to safely secure grandson. It would have been easier if they had designed a system that came over the head and shoulders to fasten to the buckle from between the legs. Normally, this would not be a problem but it leaves whoever is securing the child vulnerable from their rear. My daughter has the same seat for her car and while leaving a shopping mall, was approached from behind by a panhandler. A quicker in and out for the child would be a safer design for moms shopping alone.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great seat, but...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Comfy padded seat. Straps are wide and don't cut into child. But, my son rips the arm rest cup holders off every time we get in the truck. Would it have been so difficult to design a more securable cup holder? Very irritating to have to dodge them while driving...
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not aware of manufacturing date.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t even opened the boxes yet...I ordered two. But the date on the box says 2015. For an item that expires I feel like it should be clearly labeled in the description if it isn’t brand new. I have a brand new baby that will only be able to use it for 6 years when I expected her to be able to use it for 10. Highly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tough to tighten harness
customer_reviews.text: The carseat is great. I like how compact it is and the limits of rearfacing. However, my harness takes quite a bit to tighten and I dislike that a lot. We just switched from another seat that we hated the harness on, thinking this would be better. We have two extend2fits and I was so excited for them because I loved the snugrides. The harnesses are much harder to tighten with a child in the seat.
customer_reviews.author: A&J

customer_reviews.title: It's great and it fits Prius C
customer_reviews.text: When we bought this we were a little apprehensive about how it would fit in our tiny Prius C (2014 model). And it does. It does reduce the blind spot check area (since a lot of the back window is obscured by the seat), but the reduction hasn't been too big of an issue for us. We've now had this for just over a year and half now, and we are still quite happy with it. In fact, we are considering getting the same seat for our second child who is rapidly outgrowing his infant/baby car seat.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: It is so uncomfortable and bad for posture!
customer_reviews.text: We returned this carseat after trying it out facing forward and facing back, in both of our vehicles, with different reclining positions. It pushed our baby's head forward and her pelvis forward, forcing her into a "c" shape. She hated it. It looked like it would injure her back and neck, just by her sitting in it. We tried taking one of the pads out but it didn't help. Also, what a pain to install! The instructions were muddled and hard to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M Spaulding

customer_reviews.title: If your hesitant, DONT BE
customer_reviews.text: I will be purchasing this again for our 2nd vehicle! Such an amazing car seat. My daughter is on the very tall side and we just couldn’t use the infant carrier anymore. This seat is comfortable, provides plenty of space for her and seems so safe for her. We wanted something easier to install and it is! The easy latch button release takes all of 1 minute to install/release. The ONLY negative to us is the strap you pull to tighten the harness is pretty tough; you really have to tug!
customer_reviews.author: Kuter

customer_reviews.title: Straps are impossible to tighten...buy something else!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this car seat since it had good reviews and a good safety rating. This car seat is impossible to tighten. What good is a car seat that you cannot secure your child in safely? My husband and I both struggle to tighten it on our 1 year old. I honestly cannot get it tight enough. I came back and read through other reviews and am not the only one who has this issue. Graco needs to fix this before someone gets hurt. I am returning this car seat and will be purchasing something else.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Marie

customer_reviews.title: Belt jams and it’s super unsafe
customer_reviews.text: I nearly broke my thumb trying to tighten the belt to a safe tightness for my 10 month old. This product is completely ridiculous and terrible. I am hoping I won’t need surgery but it appears I have torn ligaments in my thumb. The belt doesn’t tighten well in the reverse position because you can’t pull it at the right angle. Plus the belt gets jammed. So basically I hate this product as it caused me a serious injury and now I’m trying to take care of my twin babies with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy car seat
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy car seat. Very good quality. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gunjan

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: We've always trusted the Graco brand to deliver high quality value with their products. We promoted our daughter from the snugride infant car seat to this convertible seat and set up was very easy. We really appreciate that we don't have to re-thread the seatbelt straps every time she hits a growth spurt; you just adjust the headrest and it will automatically adjust the seatbelt straps with it.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get out of for 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: Ultimately, my 1 year old is able to unbuckle the chest strap. When I called customer service, they told me that it’s not a defect, that some kids can unbuckle the chest strap. What? So, if I’m going 70 on the highway, and my 1 year old manages to unbuckle his seatbelt, that’s not a safety issue? I could understand if he was 2 or 3, but 1 is still too young. DONT BUY THIS SEAT! We bought evenflow before getting this Graco. The Evenflow was perfectly fine in regards to safety, it just wasn’t as comfortable. My son wasn’t able to unbuckle the Evenflow chest strap, but he can unbuckle this one which was more expensive. Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I HATE this car seat
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have room in the front once this seat is installed so I have to sit in the back while my husband drives. We drive a Toyota Yaris so it is a smaller car but it’s still kind of huge and resiculous. I would not recommend this car seat for infants. Our small newborn is too floppy and his head ends up twisting around due to lack of support. I would say stick to 6 months to toddlers for this seat unless you have an especially large baby. It’s a pain putting him inside. He’s so uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: visionarygrind

customer_reviews.title: Happy, comfortable granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this car seat for my 3 1/2 yr. old granddaughter. It was very easy to install and is small enough that the front driver's seat in my small SUV can still go back far enough for me to be comfortable. I used the car's built in anchors because we couldn't get the car's seat belt option to fit snug enough. My granddaughter said it is comfortable and she likes the cup holders. The extension panel is a nice feature for providing extra support and rooms for her legs, since we are still using the rear facing option. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to tighten
customer_reviews.text: It really is very difficult to tighten the straps. I had one in my primary car and bought this for a second car, just because I'm used to it and because it's like the cheapest seat out there. When rear facing, to facilitate tightening, I would pull the slack tight from behind the seat first and then pull from the strap in the front. Can't do that while facing forward, but it seems to be a little easier to tighten, probably because the straps should be anchored above the child's shoulders vs below when rear-facing. Otherwise, I think this seat is very easy to install. My daughter seems comfortable. I like the cupholders.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Silver

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SEAT after the Infant Carseat
customer_reviews.text: We got the Graco Snugride 35 for when baby was an infant, and transitioned to this after he outgrew the infant one at 35". This installed pretty much the same way, it has great legroom (our son is very tall), and lifts him up so he can actually see out the window. The little cupholders and the pockets to keep the clips when not in use are awesome features. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Holly C.

customer_reviews.title: Best choice!
customer_reviews.text: This car seat is awesome!!!! It has a leg room extender for rear facing kids. My 18 month old is the size of a 3 year old and this is such an excellent feature to make him more comfy. The belt is tough to tighten in the rear facing position, but if you pull on the straps from the back side of the car seat and then pull the pinching strap it's much easier (do a quick google search and you'll see the video that shows what I'm talking about). I love this car seat and right now it's the highest safety rated on baby gear lab. I only wish I would have known about it a year ago!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works for our tiny car!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly love this way more than our 4ever Graco car seat. There's just more space and it fits better in our Ford C-max. I put the 4ever in our Lexus and it's definitely bigger than the extend2fit. I love the design and haven't found any issues. I use it for our daughter. She's always been taller and skinny so I definitely appreciate the leg room she got with the extended2fit compared to the 4ever. I wanted to get a car seat that was smaller but obviously not giving up the safety features and how easy it is to install. This seemed to be the best option. Haven't tried cleaning it but I'm sure it's not hard.
customer_reviews.author: Kim V

customer_reviews.title: Great for long babies, buy circle replacement cup holders!
customer_reviews.text: I picked this car seat because of the leg extensions. My boy is very tall and I would like to keep him rear facing for as long as possible. This car seat allows for him to stay rear facing longer. One of the other reviews made mention of how the cup holders are square, making cups tip over, etc. The other day I was in target and noticed another Graco car seat with round cup holders. They weren’t snapped in, so I noticed they were the same clip in as the square ones. I went on Graco’s website and bought “replacement” circle ones, and installed them with ease. Now it’s the perfect car seat!
customer_reviews.author: Shanea Boswell

customer_reviews.title: Very unsafe! Terrible product.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst car seat I’ve ever used. The way the shoulder straps are designed, my daughter was constantly pulling her loose from the straps from the first day and your child will too. I was constantly having to pull over to get her back in the shoulder straps. Countless arguments with my wife to pull over to fix the straps. Finally got rid of it today and couldn’t be happier to have it out of my parenting life. I don’t know how this passed Grace’s product testing. Usually like Graco products but this is a total dud and so unsafe, it’s scary.
customer_reviews.author: CodecMan

customer_reviews.title: Ehhhh.
customer_reviews.text: I have a huge issue with the seatbelt on this chair. It's so difficult to get my daughter tightly secured in this carseat. I have found that extending the length gives more room to pull the belt but its always an ordeal. This is in my mothers car thankfully and not in mine. I spent more money on our Graco 4Ever but I absolutely love it. This seat just doesnt compare. My mother didn't want to spend the extra many and well, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth your money.
customer_reviews.text: We had to buy a new car seat for my preemie baby that would hold a 4lbs baby before we could bring him home, and we stumbled upon this car seat. I love that it “grows” with them. You can recline it and adjust the top. My preemie fit perfectly in it and was able to pass his car seat test in it. It’s very heavy! I love the colors! And not too bad of a price compared to how much they are in store and it’ll last my child the whole time he has to be in a car seat (I believe it’ll hold up to 100lbs) Definitely worth your money.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfect in F150 and Trailblazer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great car seat. I was so worried about what to get, I managed to snag this one during a sale and cannot recommend it enough. Installing it is a BREEZE. it has these clips (the kind you see for seatbelts) and you just connect that to the thingy in the middle of the back seats, the little metal holds. Tada, you got your carseat installed yay! Also my kid really likes this one, crying has decreased by 60% although that might be because she's a bit older now. Much more leg room in this carseat too. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jane N.

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice car seat
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice car seat. It is sturdy and soft. It is a little bulky for my backseat, as I drive a smaller SUV/crossover (2016 Mazda cx-5). It would be perfect if it were a little easier to take off the cover to wash it and if it weren't so wide at the back portion of the car seat. I just ordered a different brand 3 in 1 for my car and will put this car seat in my husbands truck when I get it. I will add pics for side by side comparison when it gets here.
customer_reviews.author: WifeMomNurse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect car seat
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this car seat. I purchased this for my one year old and have had my eyes on this car seat for awhile. He sits comfortably in it and is up higher. It was easy to adjust all of the straps, reclining position and headrest. The one problem I have is the cup holders. One wouldn’t snap in and the other one that did snap in my child pulled out in one day. The cup holders are useless for me because they won’t stay in. I’ve had 3 adults attempt to fix this with no luck. All in all I still love it
customer_reviews.author: Lauren C

customer_reviews.title: Hate the cover!
customer_reviews.text: I love graco car seats. I have bought 4 different ones. I originally bought the 4 in 1 but since she’s already facing forward as a spare car seat I decided to save some money and buy this extend2fit. The cover is terrible it’s such a pain to get in and off. She threw up on it and I seriously rather throw the whole thing away than take it apart again. So as much as I love graco look into the ones that have the easy covers. As for this one. Saving $20-$30 is not worth the hassle of an every day car seat that needs to be washed frequently
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: After reading some reviews where the complaint was not being able to tighten the straps tight enough for install, I was concerned but ordered. My car has those metal clips brackets in the crack of the seat so installation was super simple and the seat is tight and secure in my car. Maybe the other reviewers didn't have those metal clip things in their cars, they are expressly for car seats. I would never take a chance on a car seat that wasn't safe, so far it's a go. I haven't put my grand daughter in it yet because we just got it but I look forward to it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst install ever!
customer_reviews.text: I really dislike this car seat. It seems nice, made well. The rear extend seems nice. It’s the worst car seat to install!!! I’ve had Britax, Chicco & this one. Britax Clicktight is by far the easiest, tighest install. This one by far the worst. I can’t pull it tight enough. Even my husband, who lifts, can’t get it tight. Super annoying when that’s what you want in a car seat. I pay attention to detail & am very picky about my car seats. Don’t recommend at all. Save your frustration & spend a little more money. :)
customer_reviews.author: JRae

customer_reviews.title: Better than the 4ever
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our Prius after having the Graco forever in our other car. We actually prefer this one to the more expensive 4ever. We like that's it's less bulky. We also like the slots on the arm rests for the clips which makes getting our son in and out easier without him sitting on the straps. Couldn't be easier to install. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MomXMillennial

customer_reviews.title: Buy at cosco
customer_reviews.text: This was very very difficult to install. Also it is $20 cheaper at cosco. I like the car seat itself. Comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: marinap

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, safe, and easy to get baby into
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been using this car seat for a week so far and it has been great! We got two to keep one in each car and it fits great in both (2009 Lincoln MKX, 2015 Toyota Camry). The directions are easy to understand and installation was easy. My daughter hates car seats and this one has been easier to get her into and adjust the fit to keep her safe.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Elling

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. Poorly designed.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this seat. There is far too much of the seat's headrest extending beyond the child's head and the headrest couldn't be lowered because the headrest's sides hit the top of the shoulders. I do not have this issue with an Evenflow seat I have. My child was very uncomfortable and crying and squirming in this seat. Then there is the horrible seat cover fastening system. It's impossible to get the cover back on, especially if you don't take the seat out of the car. Again I don't have this issue with an Evenflow seat.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great for safety, longevity in use, & comfort
customer_reviews.text: My friend has two baby seats. A basic one & this one I gifted her. She has said that her baby girl never cries in this one. I am positive it is because of the extra comfort. She had been using it since December of 2018. It had been very durable & stood up so far! 1.5 yrs later Thank you Please give a 👍
customer_reviews.author: Anaya

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son a year ago and put him in it when he turned 1 years old. The straps are very hard to tightens, as if you have to put your foot on it and pull with everything you got and still doesn’t tighten as much. Had a cop redo it and same thing. I called graco and it’s been over a month and no response. I called amazon and nothing they can do because it’s been past a year. Now I’m stuck with an unsafe car seat. Yay me!!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Love this seat.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on black Friday, after researching for months. Needed a compact seat to go behind the driver's side for my husband and a CSPT recommended this one and it fits perfectly in our Ford explorer. This is the third Graco seat we've owned for our kids over time and this one is much easier to install than the others. It's a little hard to tighten the buckle but since she's rear facing I can help that by pulling the belt connector behind it too. Love the no rethread of the harness and easy recline options. Grandpa got one for his Prius and was able to set it up and install properly because of the simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: jwpink33

customer_reviews.title: Graco Extend2Fit Car Seat
customer_reviews.text: I searched for hours, read tons of reviews on car seats before deciding to purchase the Graco Extend2Fit. My granddaughter is 14 months old. She is tiny but tall so I love the extend tray for her feet. The cup holders are within her reach and a good size. The layers of padding around the head gives her a snug fit, yet are removable as her head grows. The material is a nice color and wipes clean with a sponge. It was easy to install in a Subaru Forrester and just as easy to remove when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Good seat, inexpensive, fits in small cars
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this car seat given the price, it seemed significantly less expensive than even comparable brands. After three months of use as a rearward facing seat, we have no complaints. It is fairly easy to install using the LATCH system and seems pretty comfortable. The safety ratings were among the highest I found for any convertible car seat. After seeing the size, we bought a second which fits pretty comfortably in the back seat of a small sedan. It does limit the ability to slide the front seat back all the way but not as significantly as I would have thought.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Horton

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable car seat for baby who hates car seats
customer_reviews.text: Grandma bought this car seat after reading reviews on the many Gracos available. Mom and Dad have a Doona that was handed down, and it's a great system of car seat and stroller in one. Mom and Dad love it, but baby doesn't. The Doona doesn't have much padding and he cries the entire time he's in it. However, his face lights up when Grammy puts him in the Graco. It looks like an expensive padded chair with cup holders, and the little king thinks it's his throne! We laugh about it all the time, how the little car seat connoisseur prefers the Graco and doesn't cry when he's in it. 😂
customer_reviews.author: MAP

customer_reviews.title: Made well, easy to change position.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like this car seat is made well. It adjusts easily and the baby sleeps in it which says a lot because the other seat had him bawling constantly. We purchased it because even though he was young enough to be in a pumpkin seat, he was so chunky. It was hard lifting him in and out. He fits well and this should last him till he is close to needing a booster or a larger five part harness. I love how the head part can be adjusted so easily and the same for the recline! The cup holder on each side is also super nice.
customer_reviews.author: Blessed Bayers

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT. We’ve purchased TWO. WE LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Extend2Fit. We love it! Easy to install. Lots of padding to make baby comfortable. We have transitioned both our kids to this from the infant seat at around 7-8months. It’s easy to adjust the straps, no having to pull the straps out and re-thread them. Lots of leg room. It is a little bulky, so we don’t move it from car to car often. But it’s very sturdy and safe, and I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this to anyone. For the price point, I waited for it to go on sale.... it’s a steal of a high quality car seat.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen V

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. I already own 2 graco 4evers but we need two more carseats for the other car. This is terrible compared to that. The latch belt is impossible to get properly tight. I couldnt get it and then the harness is especially hard to tighten. Its features are not as thoughtfully designed as the 4ever line. Highly recommended the Gravo 4ever and not this silly thing.
customer_reviews.author: Catcity

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy! Not Safe
customer_reviews.text: Wife just got a brand new 2019 tiguan. I figured i get a nice new car seat as well. This carseat is impossible to latch with less than 1inch movement. Its a shame because this seems like a good car seat but if you cant secure it properly its useless. I should also add im not one who would write a negative review if this was close to no movement or anything of the like, but this carseat is not easy to install and not safe.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Czajkowski

customer_reviews.title: Can’t recommend it enough. GET IT!
customer_reviews.text: I can not tell you how much I love Graco’s extend2fit. I have two other brand car seats, and I have two extend2fits. If I could do it all over again, I’d have FOUR extend2fits. I feel like my son is so safe in this car seat. It’s so easy to use. We’ve used it since he was a newborn out of the hospital. It’s so much smarter than buying an infant seat for $200 and then having to buy a car seat like this once they reach the infant weight limit, and then having to buy a booster. This seat will last my son until he is done with car seats!
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Could have done better
customer_reviews.text: Although I bought this when it was on sale. The seat still did not live up to the price I don’t think. The fabric and cushion layer is a little too thin for my son. The cup holders on two sides can easily fall off. Seriously, I don’t think it’s hard to make it sturdy. And I don’t think I’m the only person who doesn’t like this feature. And the buckles, my son can take it off by himself so that’s not safe if my wife drive alone without me. This is a big company. Could have done better.
customer_reviews.author: King Bee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to take in and out Easy to adjust Don't ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to take in and out Easy to adjust Don't like that the warning labels are printed into the seat itself. Gets real hot in the sun and can definitely burn the baby very easily so beware. Don't like the way the seat itself is constructed. My son looks very uncomfortable and awkward in it.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend. Straps are hard to tighten and release is very hard to get at with your finger.
customer_reviews.text: When this is used as a rear-facing OR forward facing car seat the button to release the straps is INCREDIBLY hard to press without twisting your finger. The straps also are very tough to pull tight for a snug and safe fit for your baby or child. I would not recommend this car seat.
customer_reviews.author: Ned man

customer_reviews.title: Great car seat EXCEPT...
customer_reviews.text: Great car seat EXCEPT tightening the straps is nearly impossible once the child is in the seat. You have to find “hacks” such as putting your hand behind the car seat under the straps and pulling to adjust it. Otherwise you have to put all your might and strength into it to be able to even barely tighten the straps! I had the Graco Snugride before this and had no issues adjusting the straps. This is nearly impossible and makes it difficult for me to want to leave the house with my 3 month old due to the fact I know how much of a pain it is going to be to get him in and out of the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Young

customer_reviews.title: Sticker on the bottom is confusing
customer_reviews.text: Bottom of the the seat has a sticker with 6 positions for forward and rear facing options. But at the end of the day the bubble level is king, so to label the sticker with a rear or forward facing range is pointless, the bubble level is king. I guess it gets you started in the right zone, but its awfully redundant and I think just adds more confusion than clarity. Otherwise seems substantially better quality and seems much more comfortable than the rear only facing seat it is replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awful, inconvenient, difficult
customer_reviews.text: This car seat is such a pain in the... it sucks...it really does. By pulling the straps as you are supposed to to tighten it, they don't get nearly tight enough, so you have to pull the straps from behind...then when you switch to forward facing, hopefully you have tiny hands to reach thru to pull them tight that way. Installing sucks, moving it sucks, washing it sucks...if your kid spills or throws up, GOOD LUCK. There are so many hooks and straps and components. It takes FOREVER to clean and reassemble. I really don't understand all the positive reviews for this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Breska

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful big carseat, best price around
customer_reviews.text: If you don’t care about the color, just go for whichever one randomly is the cheapest right now. This is gorgeous and there is a ton of legroom to enable more time in a rear facing seat. We lucked out with one that matched our car’s interior that was $100 cheaper than the same model on other sites. My baby loves the cupholders, one for snacks, one for water. Because of the extended legroom, it’s a lot easier to put her in this than it is other large rear facing car seats.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: I own 4!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this carseat! I have two (one for each car) for my 2.5yo toddler, and just bought two more for my 7 month old. It installs quickly and easily. I love the no-rethread-harness so I can quickly adjust the height of the shoulder straps. I haven't needed the extra legroom yet, but I do appreciate that it's there so my kiddo can be rear-facing longer. The only thing I don't like about it is that if you need to remove the cover for any reason (potty accident, car sickness), it's tricky to put back on. It took me maybe 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Straps are easy to tighten once you figure it out
customer_reviews.text: I almost didnt get this reading some of the reviews... but I dont find the straps hard to tighten at all. You just cant pull on the strap that is at the edge of the carseat only, you have to pull the straps behind the seat until its at a snug fit on your child, THEN pull llthe tightening strap. I actually like this, it adds a step but you are far more in control of the "strapping down".
customer_reviews.author: radams

customer_reviews.title: The perfect car seat to permanently be in your car
customer_reviews.text: I love this car seat. As a mom my anxiety level is much lower knowing my daughter is in this car seat. The only downfall is, you can’t carry a child around in it but that’s a sacrifice to make for the safety of your child. For carrying my child in and out of places I have a separate car seat, one of the Graco quick connects. Again I feel my daughter is very safe in this car seat, and it is able to be used for years down the road because it grows with the child as it grows.
customer_reviews.author: Atattooedbeauty

customer_reviews.title: Good Sturdy Carseat
customer_reviews.text: I like this car seat. It's well-designed. The colors are clean and attractive. I like that it has a spot to put the buckle when your putting your kid in the seat. So you don't have to reach underneath them to find it later. I also like the extra foot space option for when my kids legs get a little longer but I want to keep them we are facing. It's wider then the other car seat we have. Since our car is small we can't use the middle seat between our two car seats.
customer_reviews.author: Naynay

customer_reviews.title: Safe, comfy, works in small cars.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is in the 97% for height and we love that this car seat will grow with her for a long time. We are able to fit it in both my Prius and my husbands Jeep renegade behind the passenger with some leg room for the person in front. My 6’4 husband can sit in the passenger seat which he wasn’t able to do with the infant carrier car seat. It passes the smaller car test for us! It is easy to get her in and out and she loves the cup holders for her toys or cups. The padding is comfy and I like that the center padding is light colored so that it doesn’t get as hot.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great car seat -- much more roomy than expected, love the high RF weight limit
customer_reviews.text: I was seeking a car seat with a higher rear-facing weight limit -- the Graco E2F came very highly recommended. I went into this thinking "How great could it be compared to our other seat?" Oh I figured it out! Once I removed the infant padding, there was plenty of space for my large-sized toddler. The extra leg room is has been great, and he loves the cupholders. It was fairly easy to install and didn't take up much more room than our previous seat without the extra leg room. Love how easy the straps are to buckle / unbuckle as well. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Your baby is safe with Graco
customer_reviews.text: I love the adjustable features & the sturdiness. This one has a leveler ball to indicate the flatness of the base-very helpful tool! The color option was nice -not too pink. Instructions were very clear to follow. Grace has been around for decades-you can’t go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: smartshopper

customer_reviews.title: Safety is my top priority and was easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I love that this car seat is comfortable easy to install and easy to adjust. I did have to look up a video on YouTube to install it and learn how to adjust it but after that it was a piece of cake. I also love the light blue color I got I love that this car seat is comfortable easy to install and easy to adjust. I did have to look up a video on YouTube to install it and learn how to adjust it but after that it was a piece of cake. I also love the light blue color I got
customer_reviews.author: Eva a

customer_reviews.title: Don’t count the seat out Bc of the cup holders 🤦🏼‍♀️🤦🏼‍♀️
customer_reviews.text: We have two, both cars have them now. They are perfectly fine ... and as far as the cup holders go we haven't found a bottle or cup that doesn’t fit unless you’re using a big bulky cup. To solve that problem buy something a little in the slimmer side. As far as tightening the straps , our 26lb 9 month old is still rear facing and I adjust his straps for The back of the seat just Bc it’s easier for now. I like the seat it’s a nice size and my son is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Beans

customer_reviews.title: Great car seat!
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Graco 4-in-1 car seat from Costco first and fell in love with it but then when we need another car seat for our second car, Costco doesn't sell it anymore. So we decided to purchase this one, figured when it's time for booster seat, we can just get the light booster seat (and it's easy for travel as well). I love this car seat, though it's a bit harder to install and adjust comparing with 4Ever 4-in-1, this product is still great and comfortable for the kid.
customer_reviews.author: M.M.

customer_reviews.title: Love this carseat
customer_reviews.text: I've read quite a few reviews where people were saying it's hard to adjust the straps and/or can't tighten the base enough to keep it from moving. I found installation was super easy. I had a Graco Snugfit35 infant seat prior and the straps to connect to the hooks were hard to get undone and never could get really tight. This carseat was by far the easiest to install. I was also able to adjust the shoulder straps easily when we had to add a snowsuit. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tawny J Robertson

customer_reviews.title: great car set
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these. My son does not fight getting into this carseat as he did with the newborn one. Comfortable, many levels of recline. Love that it can extend but have not had to use that feature yet. SO easy to move straps up and down as they grow by simply lifting the back/headrest. No fuss with the actual straps. I was looking for a higher end brand thinking I would get something nicer, it would last long and be better overall, however after reading reviews many reviews on all carseats we decided to buy this Graco. We bought a second one after we received the first one. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: johanna

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE the Extend2Fit
customer_reviews.text: My infant doesn't care for his infant seat so we had to transition to the convertible seat before he outgrew the infant seat. I LOVE the Extend2Fit. He no longer cries every time I put him in the car seat. its low enough that I can reach an arm over to hand him a pacifier if needed and is so easy to install. The latch on this is the best when it comes to ease of use. I also love that the latch system stores and clips to the seat when not in use. Not going to lie, looks so comfy I wish it fit adults, LOL.
customer_reviews.author: JDubb

customer_reviews.title: Nice Seat - the Cinch mechanism on the belt(s) needs work
customer_reviews.text: Love the seat - features are nice. The cinch mechanism on the latch system belt is nearly impossible in some vehicles to get a good amount of tightness. Additionally, the mechanism to pull the belts tight on your little one is a little too hard to pull. You feel like you are going to strangle them, and then check the belts and they are loose. This is a function of all of the adjustable and moveable parts on the seat. You get used to it - but you're left thinking "there has to be a better way"
customer_reviews.author: Web Geek

customer_reviews.title: Great seat for the money
customer_reviews.text: We already have one of these at home for my other child. This seat is great for the price. The shoulder straps are a bit hard to tighten, but I think once you figure out the correct position it’s a bit easier. Cup holders are square so some cups don’t fit as well, but honestly I find it helpful to have 2 cup holders so my kids can put things in them and stay entertained. The leg extension is really what I like best about the seat. It keeps my kids comfortable and safe. The car seat itself is also extremely easy to take in and out of the car. Overall you really can’t beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Bad neck support
customer_reviews.text: Please look at my video, this doesn’t look comfortable. It looks like he’s going to get a stiff neck or close his airway. I’m scared to keep using it but I threw away the box thinking it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Highly reviewed for a reason!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on car seats and am pleased with this one. So far it’s working wonderfully. My baby seems comfortable in it. Best of all are the features. There’s ample padding around the head and neck, easily adjustable straps, pockets to tuck in the metal latches so they don’t get hot in the sun, adjustable leg room and head room, and it was fairly easy to install. It’s highly reviewed for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: Misty D

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 1 and about 20 lbs. It has an extendable extra leg thing and it comes in handy. We've had it about 2 weeks and I switch from my car to my husband's every weekend and it is a little hard to install but definitely not to terrible. I mean if it was I wouldnt want to switch every weekend! It seems like a great safe seat for her. I still have her rear facing and she seems to like it so that's a plus. Would definitely reccomend to others!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Best Car Seat for Bigger Babies
customer_reviews.text: So we went and bought the typical carry car seat for infants and got the two bases for two cars.... and then Baby went from skinny to chubbo! The typical new infant car seats only go up to 30 lbs. and Bubba was already 25 lbs at 6 months, so, off to shop for ANOTHER car seat (groan!). THIS car seat goes up to 50 lbs rear-facing--the best option for infants--is adjustable for several different reclining options, has a footrest that pulls out, etc. This is just an AWESOME car seat! The padding is SO much better than most of the car seats we looked at too. Great price here, great item!!
customer_reviews.author: ChattyOneTop Contributor: Quilting

customer_reviews.title: Seat is good, very difficult to remove cover
customer_reviews.text: Kiddo is 2 yrs old, 2ft 9.25in. We have not needed to use the extend fit yet. She still is rear facing. The seat seems to be fine, comfortable and safe. The 4 stars is because of the seat cover. It is THE WORST to remove and reattach when you want to wash it. Whoever designed this must not have children, or must hate parents! We also have a safety first grow and go, it also seems fine and is easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: melanie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My daughter screamed her head off in her infant car seat so when the airline lost it, we decided to order this and it’s been amazing. She did so much better. Here we are a year and half later and she has plenty of years left in it. It’s safe, long lasting, and no tears. Lol we just had a second baby so I’ll be ordering another since she too hates the infant car seat
customer_reviews.author: Vee Jones

customer_reviews.title: The installation technology is wonderful. It was very easy to set it up ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first car seat and I bought it for my 1 year old son. The installation technology is wonderful. It was very easy to set it up in my car. It took me around 5 - 8 minutes. The seat itself is well made and my son is comfortable in it. You can adjust the the head cushion and recliner angle. I think this car seat is not heavy. Quality of all car seat components are very high. I bought it dark colors which should help with hiding stains in the future. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: This seat is very roomy and comfortable. I shopped around for months before deciding to purchase and I'm so glad I settled on this one. Pros: Easy to adjust Soft/comfortable padding Lots of room to grow Easy install Cup holders are big enough for sippy cups and binky storage Takes very little space compared to our infant seat, especially for how roomy it is for baby We use the strap/clip holders and it's so much easier than the seat before. No more digging under baby to find her harness straps. Cons: Not much I can think of. I've seen on other reviews that it's hard to tighten up the straps but so far no issues for us.
customer_reviews.author: Zapped

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Install
customer_reviews.text: Basically this carseat is a case of you get what you pay for... I felt the safety, baby comfort, and length of time I could use it were on par with my Graco 4-ever flex BUT the installation with the latch system was awful. Since this was the second car seat and intended for travel and our second car (i.e., needed to be easily removable and the installation quick) this seat just didn't meet our needs. If you never have to remove it, then it's great!
customer_reviews.author: sammysam

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: Saw many reviews warning me of this problem but also saw plenty of good reviews so I decided to try it because it was on sale. It is impossible to tighten the harness straps tight enough. I was pulling the strap hard enough that our Ford Escape was moving from how hard I wrenched on the strap and it was still too loose on our baby girl. How am I supposed to expect my 100 pound girlfriend to get the harness tight if I wasn’t able to. Will definitely be trying to return this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mary J.

customer_reviews.title: I like the 50lb rear facing limit
customer_reviews.text: I like the 50lb rear facing limit. But I have a Graco 4-Ever and the Extend2Fit is WAY harder to strap my kid in for some reason. I feel like I have to pull on the strap with all my weight and it still doesn't strap him in super tight.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Hotchkin

customer_reviews.title: Need the strength of a rabid bull to tighten the harness
customer_reviews.text: I’m so disappointed with this car seat. I had researched which seat would be safest, and decided on this one. The catch is that when placing your child in the seat, once you attempt to tighten the straps, the mechanism to tighten the harness is horrible. You have to pull with all of your strength to tighten it, and even then, you may have to take a breather and try to tighten some more. I’ve used other car seats, and this was never an issue, nor should it be. I feel we’ve wasted our money on this purchase and would not recommend buying this. I’m shocked by the positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Dionne

product_meta.title: Graco Extend2Fit Convertible Car Seat | Ride Rear Facing Longer with Extend2Fit, Binx
product_meta.description: Style:2-in-1| Color:BinxThe American Academy of Pediatrics recommends children ride rear-facing until at least 2 years of age. The Extend2Fit convertible car seat features a 4-position extension panel that provides 5" of extra legroom allowing your child to safely ride rear-facing longer. The seat can be used rear-facing from 4-50 lb and forward-facing from 22-65 lb The seat features Simply Safe Adjust which allows you to adjust the height of the harness and headrest as your child grows, In Right LATCH for a one-second LATCH attachment and Fuss Free harness storage which holds the buckle out of the way, so it's easy to get baby in and out.
feature_bullets: Designed to help protect your rear-facing infant from 4-50 lb and your forward facing toddler from 22-65 lb
4-position extension panel adjusts to provide 5" additional leg room allowing your child to safely ride rear-facing longer
Up to 50 lb rear-facing allowing your child to safely ride rear-facing longer
6-position recline helps keep your growing child comfy on your many journeys together
10-position headrest adjusts easily for your growing child

Graco ProtectPlus Engineered: a combination of the most rigorous crash tests that helps protect your child in frontal, side, rear & rollover crashes; additional testing based on the New Car Assessment Program and for extreme car interior temperatures

specifications.Orientation: Convertible Seat, Forward Facing, Rear Facing
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars17,618 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
